results.title: Out of the mouths of babes (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and Heather Cook
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Nature of things”.
Focuses on Peter and Jill de Villiers, two Harvard researchers, and their contention that knowledge of a language is innate in humans and develops as the child matures biologically. Includes interviews with both scientists and highlights their work. Suitable for tertiary/teacher level.
results.description:

results.title: Out of the mouths (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Document Productions, Oral Hygiene Service and Bernice Rubens
results.brief_description: An unscripted film shot mainly in a Dorset primary school where an older pupil project on dental health is in progress. It includes discussion during a meeting of the parent/teacher association.

results.title: Out of the forest
results.creator_credit: Wallace Productions, United Steel Companies, A. Frank Bundy and Stephen Clarkson
results.brief_description: Shows some of the remarkable range of chemical products which have their origin in coal. Explains the production of coke for the blast furnaces used by steel companies.

results.title: Out of the dark
results.creator_credit: Merton Park, British Electrical Development Association, Frank A. Hoare and John Drust
results.brief_description: A record of the human struggle to bring the light of day into the darkness of night. Dr Arthur Bryant traces the early history of lighting from the open fire to the candle lit by tinder or flint. Professor Andrade continues the story, recalling the early association of the Royal Institution with many of the inventions of the 19th century, describing in turn the gas lamp, the oil lamp, the electric arc, the carbon filament lamp, the gas mantle and the fluorescent tube. The film concludes with examples of the many important everyday activities that artificial lighting has made possible.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Merton Park, British Electrical Development Association, Frank A. Hoare and John Drust

results.title: Out of the blue
results.creator_credit: Eagle-Lion, Pathe Industries, Isadore G. Goldsmith and Leigh Jason
results.brief_description: Hen pecked Arthur Earthliegh (George Brent) has a respite from one woman - his wife, only to end up in the arms of another, the drunken yet voracious Olive (Ann Dvorak) who accompanies him home one night. Unbeknownst to Arthur, Olive has a heart condition and Arthur, thinking he has killed her, places the body on the next door neighbour’s patio - all under the watchful eye of 2 elderly female residents who alert the police. By the time the police have arrived, next door neighbour David has decided to extort Earthliegh into helping him dispose of the body in exchange for Earthliegh dropping the case against having David and his dog, Rabelais (who is prone to digging up the Earthliegh’s zinnias) evicted. Cast also includes Carole Landis and Turhan Bey. Based on a story by Vera Caspary.
